text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that a lender's failure to make reasonable inquiries about occupiers can cause an overriding interest to bind them, even if it was not discovered. The candidate answer explicitly discusses this under section 3 ('Your strongest line of attack is often: \u201cI had a beneficial interest + I was in actual occupation\u201d') and section 4 ('Can you argue: \u201cThe loan was secret and after my investment, so it shouldn\u2019t beat me?\u201d'). Specifically, it mentions that if the lender didn't properly investigate or failed to get consent from an occupier, the interest may bind them, which directly addresses the concept of the lender's failure to inquire binding them to an overriding interest.", "criterion_id": "94c14c26-3d41-4b09-abe3-a18f253ce007"}
